unnormalised: **Builder Reviews Gain Traction: Are You Checking Before Booking?**
normalised: **builder reviews gain traction: are you checking before booking?**

unnormalised: Buying a flat in Mumbai or a villa in Bangalore? Hold on, folks! Savvy homebuyers are now relying heavily on builder reviews before signing on the dotted line. Forget blindly trusting that glossy brochure; it's time to dig deeper.
normalised: buying a flat in mumbai or a villa in bangalore? hold on, folks! savvy homebuyers are now relying heavily on builder reviews before signing on the dotted line. forget blindly trusting that glossy brochure; it's time to dig deeper.

unnormalised: Websites and apps dedicated to rating builders are popping up faster than biryani stalls during Eid! These platforms allow residents to share their experiences – good, bad, and downright ugly. Think of it as a "Chai pe Charcha" about construction quality, delivery timelines, and after-sales service.
normalised: websites and apps dedicated to rating builders are popping up faster than biryani stalls during eid! these platforms allow residents to share their experiences – good, bad, and downright ugly. think of it as a "chai pe charcha" about construction quality, delivery timelines, and after-sales service.

unnormalised: "I wish I'd checked reviews before booking my flat in Noida," says Ms. Sharma, a software engineer. "The promised possession date was delayed by 2 years!"
normalised: "i wish i'd checked reviews before booking my flat in noida," says missus sharma, a software engineer. "the promised possession date was delayed by two years!"

unnormalised: Dr. Khan, a retired professor from IIT Delhi, advises prospective buyers to scrutinize reviews for projects near their locality, checking for transparency and adherence to RERA guidelines. After all, who wants to pay Rs. 1.5 Cr for a 1200 sq ft flat that's constantly leaking? Doing your homework can save you a lot of heartache (and Rs.!). So, before you invest your hard-earned money, remember: check those reviews!
normalised: doctor khan, a retired professor from I I T delhi, advises prospective buyers to scrutinize reviews for projects near their locality, checking for transparency and adherence to R E R A guidelines. after all, who wants to pay rupee one point five crore for a one thousand two hundred square feet flat that's constantly leaking? doing your homework can save you a lot of heartache (and rupees!). so, before you invest your hard-earned money, remember: check those reviews!
